value:
SELECT
  'bar' as type,
  category as x,
  'Crime category' as x_label,
  COUNT(*) / 1000 as y,
  'Number of events (in thousands)' as y_label
FROM
  crimes
GROUP BY
  category

value.name: (DrillDown) Total crimes in a city in a year
(Iceberg) Neighbourhoods in Denver with highest theft
(Iceberg) Neighbourhoods with most number of severe crimes

value:
SELECT
  'bar' as type,
  month AS x,
  COUNT(*) / 1000 as y,
  'Month (Jan = 0, Dec = 11)' as x_label,
  '# of crimes (in thousands)' as y_label
FROM
  crimes,
  dates
WHERE
  crimes.start_date_key = dates.key
GROUP BY
  month

SELECT
  dates.year,
  dates.month,
  dates.day_of_the_month,
  COUNT(*)
FROM
  crimes,
  dates
WHERE
  crimes.start_date_key = dates.key
GROUP BY
  ROLLUP(dates.year, dates.month, dates.day_of_the_month)
LIMIT
  10

SELECT
  'pie' as type,
  COUNT(*) as y,
  '# of crimes' as y_label,
  city as x,
  'City' as x_label
FROM
  cross_join
WHERE
  month = { month | 2 }
  AND year = { year | 2016 }
GROUP BY
  city

SELECT
  *
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      'bar' as type,
      neighbourhood as x,
      'Neighbourhood' as x_label,
      COUNT(*) :: float / 1000 as y,
      '# of crimes (in thousands)' as y_label
    FROM
      cross_join
    WHERE
      city = { city | Denver }
      AND category = { category | Larceny }
    GROUP BY
      neighbourhood
  ) AS r
WHERE
  r.y >= { count threshold | 0.8 }
ORDER BY
  r.y DESC

SELECT
  'bar' as type,
  AVG(count) as y,
  neighbourhood as x,
  'Neighbourhood' as x_label,
  'Average monthly crime rate' as y_label
FROM(
    SELECT
      COUNT(*),
      month,
      neighbourhood
    FROM
      cross_join
    WHERE
      neighbourhood != ''
    GROUP BY
      (neighbourhood, month)
  ) AS r
GROUP BY
  neighbourhood

SELECT
  COUNT(*) AS num_crimes,
  MIN(year) AS year,
  MIN(city) AS city
FROM
  cross_join
WHERE
  year = { year | 2016 }
  AND city = { city | Vancouver }

SELECT
  COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY neighbourhood) AS neighbourhood_crime_rate,
  *
FROM
  cross_join
WHERE
  neighbourhood != ''
LIMIT
  10

SELECT
  *
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      'bar' as type,
      neighbourhood AS x,
      COUNT(*) :: float / 1000 AS y,
      '# of crimes (in thousands)' as y_label
    FROM
      cross_join
    WHERE
      severity > 10
      AND neighbourhood != ''
    GROUP BY
      neighbourhood
  ) AS r
WHERE
  r.y > { count threshold | 1.2 }
ORDER BY
  r.y DESC
